question: Which of the following options best relates to the poem 'Dreams' <image 1>?
options: ['The father is compared to a gypsy.', 'The danger of letting go of a dream.', 'Keep hold of your dream.', "Let's celebrate bold women!"]
description:
The image features a dark gray background with an artistic depiction of a bird in flight, seemingly made up of chain-link fence material. At the top, the word "DREAMS" is prominently displayed in large, bold, orange letters. Below this title, there is a poem written in white text. The poem reads:

"Hold onto dreams  
For if dreams die  
Life is like a  
broken-winged bird  
That cannot fly  
Hold fast to dreams  
For when dreams go  
Life is a barren field  
Frozen with snow"

The poem is attributed to Langston Hughes, whose name appears below the text in smaller white font. At the bottom of the image, there is a hashtag "#dontgiveupworld" in white text.

The poem emphasizes the importance of holding onto one's dreams and the negative consequences of losing them, comparing life without dreams to a broken-winged bird that cannot fly and a barren field frozen with snow. This imagery underscores the theme of the necessity of dreams for a fulfilling life.
